text: I've just installed the Julia 1.6 beta, and can't precompile Turing. Is there a lot of work to do to enable that? Is there an issue on GH (or other resource) that holds info on this?

elements.text: I've just installed the Julia 1.6 beta, and can't precompile Turing. Is there a lot of work to do to enable that? Is there an issue on GH (or other resource) that holds info on this?

text: Installing, loading, and compiling Turing on Julia 1.6 works fine for me. It installs not the most recent version though (0.15.1 instead of 0.15.8) since Libtask_jll is not compatible with Julia > 1.5. It then installs an older version of Libtask without Libtask_jll which however does not work with Julia 1.6. I.e., everything apart from the particle filter methods should work fine, we also test the underlying model and sampler framework already on Julia 1.6. There's not much we can do about Libtask_jll - Libtask.jl is patched and there is an open PR to Yggdrasil that fixes 1.6 compatibility but it requires `libjulia_1.6` which is available only when Julia 1.6 is released. I assume one can build the fix locally but I haven't tried myself; then one should be able to use the latest Turing and Libtask_jll versions already now.
